vague_description: How to allocate healthcare workers within a fixed budget to meet labor hours requirements.
detailed_description: A clinic employs nurses and pharmacists to deliver shots to patients. A nurse works \param{HoursNurse} hours per shift while a pharmacist works \param{HoursPharmacist} hours per shift. Nurses are paid \param{PayNurse} per shift while pharmacists are paid \param{PayPharmacist} per shift. Currently, the clinic needs \param{TotalHours} hours of healthcare labor to meet needs. If the firm has a budget of \param{Budget}, how many of each healthcare worker should be scheduled to minimize the total number of workers?
target_objective: Minimize the total number of nurses and pharmacists
target_constraints: Total hours worked by nurses and pharmacists must meet or exceed TotalHours
Total amount paid to nurses and pharmacists cannot exceed Budget
Number of nurses is an integer
Number of pharmacists is an integer
target_parameters: Number of hours a nurse works per shift
Number of hours a pharmacist works per shift
Payment for a nurse per shift
Payment for a pharmacist per shift
Total required hours of healthcare labor
